pullRequest.title: Adding distinct count support based on bitmap
pullRequest.bodyText:
We currently use IntHashSet to store distinct values for DistinctCount aggregation function.
Added a new DistinctCountBitmap aggregation function which uses RoaringBitmap to store the distinct values which is more efficient, especially for ser/de.
Also added star-tree support for this new function.

beforeCommit.message: Adding distinct count support based on bitmap

nodes.bodyText: So DistinctCount stores dictionaryId in IntHashSet (with your recent change) and here we store them in a bitmap. I am guessing this is more space efficient?

This doesn't really look like a good use of bitmap for space efficiency purpose. We are storing the hashcodes of real values in the bitmap for result extraction
Since the range of hashcodes could be arbitrary (as opposed to 0 .. N-1 for dictionaryIds), I wonder if bitmap will end up consuming more space here?
Do we not need to add end-to-end query execution test for the new function without star tree as well
